{"step_by_step_thinking": "Oral contraceptives contain ethinylestradiol and progesterone. Rifampin, a part of the patient's anti-TB regimen, is known to induce the CYP3A4 enzyme, which metabolizes these hormones, leading to their decreased serum levels. This can result in contraceptive failure. The other options do not correctly describe the interaction between rifampin and oral contraceptives.", "answer_choice": "A"}
